definitions: at or to a short distance or time away
very nearly but not completely; almost reaching
examples: Stand close to the wall for support
The store is close to my house
We came close to winning the game
The estimate was close to the actual cost

definitions: used to emphasize that something is true or certain
used to emphasize agreement or add information
examples: She is indeed a talented musician here
The weather is indeed beautiful today
Did you finish? Indeed I did yesterday
It's difficult, indeed almost impossible

definitions: to some extent; somewhat or rather in degree
examples: It's kind of cold outside today actually
I'm kind of tired after work tonight

definitions: on or during the day after today
examples: I'll see you tomorrow morning at eight
Tomorrow will be a better day hopefully

definitions: in or toward the front; in advance of others
before the expected or usual time; early
toward future success or progress; onward
examples: Look ahead when you're driving the car
The road ahead is clear of traffic
Plan ahead for your vacation next month
She's always thinking ahead about problems
Go ahead with your presentation now please
We're moving ahead with the project

definitions: quickly; at high speed or rate of movement
firmly fixed, attached, or closed; securely
examples: She runs fast every morning for exercise
Don't drive too fast on wet roads
Hold fast to the railing while climbing
The door was stuck fast and wouldn't open

definitions: for that reason; consequently as a logical result
examples: He was late; therefore, he missed the meeting
I think, therefore I am, said Descartes

definitions: moving in one side and out the other side
having finished or completed an activity thoroughly
examples: The train goes through the tunnel daily
Read through the document carefully please
Are you through with your homework yet?
We're through with this project finally

definitions: in a way that is easily seen or understood clearly
examples: She's obviously very talented at singing
Obviously, we need to change our approach

definitions: without anyone else present; by oneself solitary
only; exclusively and nothing else
examples: She lives alone in a small apartment
I prefer to work alone without distractions
The ticket alone costs fifty dollars today
Time alone will tell if we're right

definitions: in the end, especially after delay or problems
examples: She eventually found her lost keys yesterday
Eventually, all problems find their solutions somehow

definitions: past and beyond a place or position
through the action or means of something
examples: The bus went by without stopping today
She walked by the store this morning
Travel by train is more comfortable now
Send it by email for faster delivery

definitions: at once; instantly without any intervening time or delay
examples: Call the doctor immediately, it's an emergency
She immediately understood the problem and acted

definitions: in a straight line or by the shortest route
without anyone or anything intervening; personally
examples: Go directly to the hospital without stopping
The sun shone directly into my eyes
Speak directly to the manager about this
The decision directly affects our future plans

definitions: quickly and unexpectedly; happening without warning
examples: The car suddenly stopped in the road
She suddenly realized she'd forgotten her wallet

definitions: without difficulty or effort; in easy manner
without doubt; very likely or probably
examples: She easily solved the math problem quickly
The door opens easily with this key
That could easily happen if we're careless
She's easily the best player here

definitions: any longer; from now on used with negatives
examples: I don't live there anymore since June
She doesn't work here anymore unfortunately

definitions: and other similar things; and so forth
examples: Bring pens, pencils, notebooks, etc. tomorrow
We serve pizza, pasta, salads, etc. daily

definitions: in most cases; usually or typically happening
without regard to specific details; broadly speaking
examples: She generally arrives on time for meetings
People generally prefer warm weather over cold
Generally speaking, the plan seems good overall
The rules generally apply to all students

definitions: moving forward on a course or path
in company with someone; together as companions
examples: Walk along the beach at sunset time
Move along, there's nothing to see here
Come along with us to the party
Bring your friend along if you want

definitions: in or into the interior; within a container or building
examples: Come inside before it starts raining hard
The keys are inside my jacket pocket

definitions: mainly; for the most part in most cases
examples: The weather is mostly sunny this week
She mostly works from home these days

definitions: without doubt; for certain in a definite manner
examples: I'll definitely be there tomorrow morning early
This is definitely the right answer here

definitions: certainly; without doubt used for emphasis
examples: Sure enough, it started raining heavily
I sure hope you're right about this

definitions: in a different way or manner; differently
in other respects; apart from that; or else
examples: I couldn't act otherwise in that situation
Think otherwise and you'll find solutions
The food was cold; otherwise, everything was fine
Study hard, otherwise you might fail tomorrow

definitions: to a very great degree; very much intensely
at or to a high level or position
examples: She's highly intelligent and creative too
This is highly recommended by experts everywhere
He's highly placed in the government hierarchy
The bird flew highly above the clouds

definitions: in a genuine or sincere way; really
accurately or exactly according to facts
examples: I truly appreciate your help with this
She's truly talented at playing violin
Tell me truly what happened last night
This truly represents our best effort

definitions: as far as one can see or understand; seemingly
examples: She's apparently not coming to dinner tonight
Apparently, the meeting was cancelled yesterday morning

definitions: completely; entirely in every way or respect
examples: I totally agree with your opinion here
The building was totally destroyed by fire

definitions: at the present time; now as things stand
examples: She's currently working on a new project
We're currently experiencing technical difficulties today

definitions: on the day before today in the past
examples: I saw her yesterday at the mall
Yesterday was the hottest day this summer

definitions: in or to some place not known or specified
examples: Let's go somewhere quiet to talk privately
I left my keys somewhere in the house

definitions: in a serious manner; not joking or trivial
to a severe or worrying degree
examples: Are you seriously considering that job offer?
She takes her work seriously every day
He was seriously injured in the accident
The economy is seriously damaged by inflation

definitions: approximately; about in the manner of informal
as if; in the same way that
examples: It costs like twenty dollars or so
There were like fifty people at party
She acts like she owns the place
It looks like it might rain today

definitions: before noon; in the morning hours specifically
examples: The meeting is at 9 am tomorrow
I wake up at 6 am daily

definitions: completely or entirely to the fullest extent possible
examples: I fully understand your concerns about this
The hotel is fully booked this weekend

definitions: at or to a lower position or level
lower than a particular amount or standard
examples: The temperature dropped below zero last night
Look at the diagram below this paragraph
Sales are below expectations this quarter unfortunately
Her grade was below the class average

definitions: in fundamental or essential respects; fundamentally
used to indicate summary of main points
examples: The two ideas are basically the same
She's basically a good person at heart
Basically, we need more time to finish
So basically, you're saying no to proposal

definitions: two times; on two occasions or instances
examples: I've been there twice this month already
Think twice before making that decision please

definitions: at or to a higher place or position
higher than a particular amount, level or standard
examples: The plane flew above the clouds smoothly
See the example above for clarification
Temperatures rose above normal yesterday afternoon
Her performance was above average this term

definitions: at a slow speed or pace; not quickly
examples: Please speak slowly so I can understand
The turtle moved slowly across the path

definitions: perhaps; it may be true or happen
within the limits of ability or capacity
examples: She'll possibly arrive late due to traffic
This is possibly the best solution available
I'll come as soon as I possibly can
How can you possibly know that already?

definitions: in some way not yet known or specified
examples: We'll manage somehow, don't worry about it
Somehow she always knows when I'm lying

definitions: in a direct line without curves or angles
immediately without delay or detour
in an honest and direct way
examples: Walk straight ahead for two blocks
The road runs straight through the valley
Go straight home after school today please
She went straight to bed after dinner
Give it to me straight, no lies
I'll be straight with you about this

definitions: to a small degree; somewhat but not very
examples: The temperature is slightly warmer today thankfully
She's slightly taller than her sister now

definitions: in or to any place; no matter where
examples: You can sit anywhere you like here
I can't find my keys anywhere today

definitions: in relation or comparison to something else considered
examples: The test was relatively easy this time
She's relatively new to the company still

definitions: to a very great degree; very much beyond normal
examples: The weather is extremely hot today unfortunately
She's extremely talented at mathematics and science

definitions: for all future time; for always eternally
for a very long time informally
examples: I'll love you forever and always truly
Nothing lasts forever in this world unfortunately
This meeting is taking forever to finish
We waited forever for the bus today

definitions: far down or in from surface or edge
profoundly or intensely in feeling or thought
examples: Dig deep to find the water table
The submarine dove deep beneath the surface
Think deep about this important decision carefully
She breathed deep to calm her nerves
